definition: tall conical paper hat worn as a public humiliation/dunce cap/(fig.) flattery
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
hat/cap
old variant of 帽[mao4]
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
(coll.) to be the object of flattery/to be placed on a pedestal

sentences.english: Most likely you've worn many different hats during your career.
sentences.chinese: 比方说在你的职业生涯中有很多顶高帽子。

sentences.english: My wife pulls into the street parade, receive flattery or compliment, she what sin?
sentences.chinese: 把我老婆拉到街上游街，戴高帽子，她有什么罪？

sentences.english: I nearly burst out laughing when I saw him in that cheesy top hat.
sentences.chinese: 看见他戴那顶俗不可耐的高帽子我都快笑出声了。

sentences.english: Maybe, even if I should wrap him with flatteries, he would not give it up!
sentences.chinese: 我就是给他连戴十顶高帽子，只怕也不管事。

sentences.english: Witches wear black clothes and tall hats.
sentences.chinese: 巫婆穿着黑色的衣服和高帽子。

sentences.english: Lavishing praises on someone in front of him was – called "giving tall hat".
sentences.chinese: 当面奉承某人叫做给这个人戴高帽子。

sentences.english: This is a heavier punishment than wearing the tall paper-hat.
sentences.chinese: 这是比戴高帽子更重的罪。

sentences.english: I am wearing a red hat.
Thee Chinese people call flattery to someone's face "presenting a tall hat" to someone.
sentences.chinese: 中国人把当面说奉承话叫做给某人人“戴高帽子”。

sentences.english: I've prepared a hundred 'tall hat', and will give each one I meet one.
sentences.chinese: 我已准备了一百顶高帽子，凡遇到的人每人给一顶。

definition: (coll.) to be the object of flattery/to be placed on a pedestal
to tag sb with unfair label/power word
to buckle up/to fasten
black hat (worn by feudal official)/fig. official post
Western-style man's hat
to make a scapegoat of sb/to defame/to slander
to bludgeon/to hit with a big stick
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
toady/bootlicker
manner/style/panache
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
to parade oneself ostentatiously about town (idiom)
to parade sb through the streets/to march or parade in the streets
to blow one's own trumpet (idiom)
ridiculous talk/preposterous remark
to blow one's own horn (idiom)
